title: 2  Megamation
text:
2.1 Access Instructions

IT will create your Megamation account.
Citrix Workspace App needs to be downloaded. It is a secure interface to the webpage where Megamation lives. Download it from here.
Click “Citrix Workspace app [XXXX] for Windows”. Install it and do not click any optional boxes like “Add account”. 
Add https://sso.megamation.com/ to your “Chrome Settings - Cookies - Always clear cookies when windows are closed”. See the very bottom of this screenshot:

The need for clearing cookies is we need a new session id each time we start Chrome.

Using the link in 4., access Citrix via a private browser (e.g. Chrome’s Incognito Mode) to avoid a cache. You will see this web page.

The need for the incognito window has to do with CCS encryption where if we get kicked out of UofG’s Central login we cannot log back into Megamation.

Click D in this part of the webpage:

This application will open on your taskbar with the icon 
NB Never click the outermost X (very top right) on the following screenshot of a Citrix instance; it severs connection to the database and IT will need to reinstate the connection.

title: 2  Megamation
text:
2.2 Megamation Export Example

2.2.1 Define the export
Click “Analysis” and then “Export Definition Wizard”.

Click “Next”.

Select a table.

Click “Next”, and then “Add”. Add among the fields from the table that pops up on the right.

Click “Next” again and again… You can select some options if you want.


2.2.2 Do the export
Click “Analysis” and then “Export Reports”.

Click “Export” at bottom right. Click off “Auto-format Spreadsheet” if you want a faster export.
 NB for big files: the Excel file that pops up after clicking Export” may not be ready and may still be populating. This is why we use “Automated Report” (second image under Define the export) for big exports. “Automated Report” will do automatically do the export in the morning and save it. If not using “Automated Report”, make sure to save the Excel pop-up file before closing.
Click “Utilities” and the following.

Files can then be selected to be emailed or downloaded.

title: 2  Megamation
text:
2.3 Checking Work Orders
If Steve asks about a work order, Evan usually follows these steps:

Export Request

Pick ML WO Inquiry (Matt Laury Work Order)
Filter by

Building number: e.g. 72
Status: CL is closed, so filter out CL if you are looking for open orders

Export
Sort and look for, say, mold in the Work Description
Find work order number e.g. 192331

Work Order Completion

Enter the work order number
See if it was scheduled and when it was issued

There is no way AFAWK to get date it was scheduled vs. issued

title: 2  Megamation
text:
2.4 Notes on Filters

Fund

100 series: Core of the university
300 series: ???
500 series: Ancillary

Residences
Hospitality
Particular research spaces


Unit

I.e. department. “XX” suffix is the set of all suffixes. “99” is general but does not contain other sets.

Grant

E.g. if a researcher needs something to be fixed using their grant money.

Project

Unique code.
Projects starting with 8 are internal and will not have a grant number.

title: Preface
text:
Definitions

Work order: A request/order for work to be done on campus.
Megamation: Software used by the university to track work. Chapter 2 describes how to access and use Megamation.

title: 8  Done
text:
8.2 Snow Shovel Route Self-Updating Table
NB:
To add in a Qualtrics chapter:
Make sure the project name does not have a “/”. Otherwise fetch_survey() will give an error of being unable to remove file ‘C:2CJ/temp.zip’, reason ‘Permission denied’.

  excludes weekends

title: 8  Done
text:
8.3 Tasks for Steve

CUPE 1334 birthdates and seniority dates for active employees for projections of retirements. CUPE 1334 is our PR trades and service local. Show name (sort alphabetical), birth date and start date.
For Jan 1, 2022 until now, can you query out any work orders for the following buildings that are coded “DM”? 072, 180, 181, 067, 172, 062, 004, 186, 011, 008. Separate sheets by building.
